wikipedia_page.main: Edna Annie Crichton (9 May 1876 – 5 March 1970) was lord mayor of York from 1941 to 1942, the first woman to hold that position.

link_mentions.page: List of the first women holders of political offices in Europe
response: *Lord Mayor of York – Edna Annie Crichton – 1941

link_mentions.page: List of lord mayors of York
response: |1941–1942 ||Edna Annie Crichton||First woman to be Lord Mayor

Gretton was born in Gloucester on 1 May 1871 when her first name was May. Her father, Joseph Marshall Sturge JP was a merchant, her mother was Anne (Annie) Burke, was a historian. Her father came from a leading abolitionist family and her mother's family had been slave owners. She and her younger sister Edna Annie Crichton attended Sidcot School. Edna would be Lord mayor of York. Mary went on to another Quaker school The Mount School in York, before going on to study at Mason College in Birmingham.

link_mentions.page: List of first women mayors (20th century)
response: ::Edna Annie Crichton, first woman Lord Mayor of York, England, United Kingdom
